gvk.title: Schema for Kubernetes API group, version and kind
gvk.description: It can be used to specify which CustomResourceDefinition is used.

additionalConfig.title: Additional config
additionalConfig.description: Additional configuration to be merged with the Ignition. More info: https://coreos.github.io/ignition/operator-notes/#config-merging.

systemd.title: systemd
systemd.description: It describes the desired state of the systemd units.

storage.title: Storage
storage.description: It describes the desired state of the system’s storage devices.

directories.title: Directories
directories.description: The list of directories to be created.

filesystem.title: Filesystem
filesystem.description: The internal identifier of the filesystem in which to create the directory. This matches the last filesystem with the given identifier.

path.title: Path
path.description: The absolute path to the directory.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: Whether to delete preexisting nodes at the path.

id.title: ID
id.description: The user ID of the owner.

name.title: Name
name.description: The user name of the owner.

group.title: Group
group.description: It specifies the group of the owner.

id.title: ID
id.description: The group ID of the owner.

name.title: Name
name.description: The group name of the owner.

filesystems.title: File systems
filesystems.description: The list of filesystems to be configured and/or used in the “files” section. Either “mount” or “path” needs to be specified.

items.title: File system
items.description: The filesystem to be configured and/or used in the “files” section. Either “mount” or “path” needs to be specified.

name.title: Name
name.description: The identifier for the filesystem, internal to Ignition. This is only required if the filesystem needs to be referenced in the “files” section.

mount.title: Mount
mount.description: It contains the set of mount and formatting options for the filesystem. A non-null entry indicates that the filesystem should be mounted before it is used by Ignition.

device.title: Device
device.description: The absolute path to the device. Devices are typically referenced by the /dev/disk/by-* symlinks.

format.title: Format
format.description: The filesystem format (ext4, btrfs, or xfs).

wipeFilesystem.title: Wipe filesystem
wipeFilesystem.description: Whether or not to wipe the device before filesystem creation, see Ignition’s documentation on filesystems for more information https://github.com/coreos/ignition/blob/main/docs/operator-notes.md#filesystem-reuse-semantics.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any additional options to be passed to the format-specific mkfs utility.

items.name: Option
items.description: An additional option to be passed to the format-specific mkfs utility.

path.title: Path
path.description: The mount-point of the filesystem. A non-null entry indicates that the filesystem has already been mounted by the system at the specified path. This is really only useful for “/sysroot”.

strict.title: Strict
strict.description: It controls if AdditionalConfig should be strictly parsed. If so, warnings are treated as errors.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the unit. This must be suffixed with a valid unit type (e.g. “thing.service”).

enabled.title: Enabled?
enabled.description: Whether or not the service shall be enabled. When true, the service is enabled. When false, the service is disabled. When omitted, the service is unmodified. In order for this to have any effect, the unit must have an install section.

mask.title: Masked?
mask.description: Whether or not the service shall be masked. When true, the service is masked by symlinking it to /dev/null.

dropins.title: Unit drop-ins
dropins.description: The list of drop-ins for the unit

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the drop-in. This must be suffixed with “.conf”

global.title: Global properties
global.description: Properties that are available to all charts and subcharts.

connectivity.title: Connectivity
connectivity.description: Configuration of connectivity and networking options.

items.title: Pod subnet
items.description: IPv4 address range for pods, in CIDR notation.

items.title: Service subnet
items.description: IPv4 address range for kubernetes services, in CIDR notation.

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Whether/how outgoing traffic is routed through proxy servers.

httpProxy.title: HTTP proxy
httpProxy.description: To be passed to the HTTP_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

httpsProxy.title: HTTPS proxy
httpsProxy.description: To be passed to the HTTPS_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: To be passed to the NO_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

addressesTemplate.title: Addresses template
addressesTemplate.description: Name of Helm template that renders a YAML array with NO_PROXY addresses

caPem.title: Certificate authority
caPem.description: Identity provider's CA certificate in PEM format.

issuerUrl.title: Issuer URL
issuerUrl.description: Exact issuer URL that will be included in identity tokens.

replicas.title: Replicas
replicas.description: The number of control plane nodes.

components.title: Components
components.description: Advanced configuration of machine and cluster components.

registries.title: Container registries
registries.description: Endpoints and credentials configuration for container registries.

auth.title: Auth
auth.description: Base64-encoded string from the concatenation of the username, a colon, and the password.

identitytoken.title: Identity token
identitytoken.description: Used to authenticate the user and obtain an access token for the registry.

password.title: Password
password.description: Used to authenticate for the registry with username/password.

username.title: Username
username.description: Used to authenticate for the registry with username/password.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: These annotations are added to all Kubernetes resources defining this cluster.

description.title: Cluster description
description.description: User-friendly description of the cluster's purpose.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: These labels are added to all Kubernetes resources defining this cluster.

name.title: Cluster name
name.description: Unique identifier, cannot be changed after creation.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: The name of organization that owns the cluster.

servicePriority.title: Service priority
servicePriority.description: The relative importance of this cluster.

sshSsoPublicKey.title: SSH public key for single sign-on

components.title: Components
components.description: Internal configuration of various components that form the Kubernetes cluster.

kubelet.title: Kubelet
kubelet.description: Kubelet configuration that is used on all nodes.

gracefulNodeShutdown.title: Graceful node shut down
gracefulNodeShutdown.description: It enables kubelet to gracefully evict pods during a node shutdown. It is enabled by default in Kubernetes 1.21.

shutdownGracePeriod.title: Shutdown grace period
shutdownGracePeriod.description: Specifies the total duration that the node should delay the shutdown by. This is the total grace period for pod termination for both regular and critical pods.

shutdownGracePeriodCriticalPods.title: Shutdown grace period for critical pods
shutdownGracePeriodCriticalPods.description: Specifies the duration used to terminate critical pods during a node shutdown. This should be less than shutdownGracePeriod.

timesyncd.title: timesyncd
timesyncd.description: systemd-timesyncd is a system service that may be used to synchronize the local system clock with a remote Network Time Protocol (NTP) server.

npt.title: NTP
npt.description: A list of NTP server host names or IP addresses.

additionalAdmissionPlugins.title: Additional admission plugins
additionalAdmissionPlugins.description: A list of plugins to enable, in addition to the default ones that include DefaultStorageClass, DefaultTolerationSeconds, LimitRanger, MutatingAdmissionWebhook, NamespaceLifecycle, PersistentVolumeClaimResize, Priority, ResourceQuota, ServiceAccount and ValidatingAdmissionWebhook.

apiAudiences.title: API audiences
apiAudiences.description: Identifiers of the API. The service account token authenticator will validate that tokens used against the API are bound to at least one of these audiences. If the --service-account-issuer flag is configured and this flag is not, 'api-audiences' field defaults to a single element list containing the issuer URL.

templateName.title: Template name
templateName.description: The name of the Helm template which renders the 'api-audiences' value

serviceAccountIssuer.title: Service account issuer
serviceAccountIssuer.description: Configuration of the identifier of the service account token issuer. You must specify either URL or clusterDomainPrefix (only one, not both).

url.title: URL
url.description: This URL is used as the identifier of the service account token issuer.

clusterDomainPrefix.title: Cluster domain prefix
clusterDomainPrefix.description: Prefix that is prepended to the cluster domain name, so that resulting URL is used as the identifier of the service account token issuer.

resources.title: Resources configuration
resources.description: GVK and other configuration for control plane resources.

kubeadmConfig.title: Kubeadm config
kubeadmConfig.description: Kubeadm config for all control plane and worker nodes.

preKubeadmCommands.title: Pre-kubeadm commands
preKubeadmCommands.description: Extra commands to run before kubeadm runs.

resources.title: Resources configuration
resources.description: GVK and other configuration for provider-specific infrastructure resources.
